title: What are some examples of patented software? List as much as you can. - Quora

response.answer_text: If you just type “software” in to a Google Patent search, you will gets screens full of patents that are at least related to software. There will be many others outside of this search that don’t use the word “software” but are still about software, but let’s start with this set. A simple (but not all-inclusive) way to determine whether the patent is on software, is to read the “method” claims, which describe a series of actions to produce a result. For example, a method claim may include an action such as “… generating data representing an aggregated dependency graph for a plurality of nodes of a hierarchy graph of software elements in the project …”. While that does not specify a computer program, you know that it must be. Who is going to hand-assemble a dependency graph of software elements? What this will not tell you is whether this software is commercially available, or whether it even has a name.
response.upvotes: Answer requested by Yann Domingos Manuel

response.answer_text: Almost ALL software available commercially is protected by patents. So “list as much as you can” is really irrelevant. It may be easier to list what is NOT covered by patents.
